channel.title: BBC News - UK
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Nadhim Zahawi appointed as vaccine rollout minister
item.description: Nadhim Zahawi will oversee distributing the vaccine in England until at least summer 2021.

item.title: Covid: More than 150 arrests at London anti-lockdown protest
item.description: Police said they expected arrests to continue to rise following the protest in central London.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Mass testing in communities to begin
item.description: Residents without symptoms in Glasgow, Ayrshire, Renfrewshire and Clackmannanshire will be offered tests.

item.title: 'Imminent' UDA threats made against Sunday World journalists
item.description: The threats come from loyalist paramilitaries, according to the National Union of Journalists (NUJ).

item.title: Durham van traveller Esther Dingley missing in Pyrenees
item.description: Esther Dingley disappeared on a solo hike during a six-year journey through Europe in a campervan.

item.title: Lake District National Park suspends trail hunting amid investigation
item.description: The National Trust also pauses licenses for trail hunts on its land after complaints made to police.

item.title: Channel crossings: More officers to patrol French beaches
item.description: The UK and France agree new measures to help stop migrants crossing the Channel.

item.title: Arcadia: Buyers to 'pick over carcass' of Topshop owner, says former boss
item.description: Breaking up the Arcadia empire is "the only way" forward, former chief executive Lord Rose says.

item.title: 'When it's brutal in the Cairngorms, it can kill you'
item.description: Willie Anderson looks back on 40 years as a mountain rescuer in some of Scotland's toughest terrain.

item.title: Covid crisis hits Talyllyn and other steam railways
item.description: Wales' famous narrow-gauge railways "would get more generous Covid financial help in England".

item.title: New apple variety discovered by runner
item.description: Experts have confirmed the apple found by Archie Thomas has never been seen before.

item.title: Covid: Newport care nurse returned to work but nearly died
item.description: Jamie Branagan urges people to take Covid-19 seriously after it left him unable to work again.

item.title: Covid and schools: 'Children know things aren't right'
item.description: Students have lost hundreds of days of education to Covid and self-isolation. How are they coping?

item.title: Liverpool: How one city took on the Covid-19 crisis
item.description: The inside story of how Liverpool got to grips with soaring infection rates and pioneered mass testing.

item.title: Travelling at Christmas: What you need to know
item.description: How will UK transport be affected by the five-day relaxation of Covid restrictions over Christmas?

item.title: Covid-19: 'People have got clean on Zoom - that's amazing'
item.description: Jade Hargreaves says video-calling during lockdown has helped people beat addiction.

item.title: Covid: Has England's lockdown worked?
item.description: England is moving out of national restrictions into a tougher tier system than before. But why?

item.title: Covid: When does England's lockdown actually end? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about the Oxford vaccine.

item.title: Covid: New London garden to commemorate pandemic victims
item.description: The 33 blossoming trees – one for each London borough - will form the centrepiece of the garden.

item.title: Kate warns of lockdown loneliness for parents
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge highlights a "dramatic increase" in parents feeling cut off from support.

item.title: Oxford Covid vaccine: Regulator asked to assess jab
item.description: The referral is "a significant first step" to a possible rollout of the vaccine, the government says.

item.title: Lockdown asylum freeze puts Iraqi doctor 'in limbo'
item.description: "Karim" wanted to help the NHS but the pandemic put his asylum claim on hold.

item.title: London Bridge attack: 'I think about it every single day'
item.description: Former prisoner Marc Conway remembers the London Bridge attack one year on.

item.title: Leroy Logan: Who is the Met Police officer in Steve McQueen's Red, White and Blue?
item.description: Star Wars' John Boyega is set to star in the true story of a black police officer in 1980s London.

item.title: Gary Barlow: 'I'm not as confident as I was at 21'
item.description: The star discusses writing Back For Good in 15 minutes, and how Morecambe and Wise inspired a new song.

item.title: The 'Robin Hood' policemen who stole from the Nazis
item.description: How did 16 policemen come to be deported from the British Isles to Nazi-occupied Europe?

item.title: How green and profitable are e-scooters?
item.description: Wayne Ting, chief executive of e-scooter firm Lime, says there's room for improvement.

item.title: Sexual abuse: 'My boyfriend assaulted me and filmed it as I slept'
item.description: Emma was unaware she was being abused and filmed in her own home over a period of months.

item.title: Nick Robinson: Let's give politicians a chance to speak human
item.description: Today presenter Nick Robinson on why the political interview is in need of a rethink.

item.title: Is it fair for learner drivers to get points on their licence?
item.description: An 18 year old in Nottingham overturned three points he faced over a traffic offence during a lesson.

item.title: TikTok: 'I didn’t know other LGBT Muslims existed'
item.description: Until she found her social media "safe space", Shaz says she didn't know there were others like her.

item.title: 'Gambling was as normal as breathing'
item.description: Kerri Nicholls lost more than £45,000 due to gambling online.

item.title: 'Outstanding new teacher' Kirsty Gaythwaite on why she loves her job
item.description: Kirsty Gaythwaite was awarded the gold prize as an outstanding new teacher of the year, in the National Teaching Awards.

item.title: Period poverty: The Belfast school breaking the taboo
item.description: Pupils and staff at Belfast Royal Academy are trying to make sanitary products accessible for all.

item.title: Duchess of Cambridge report on early years children
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge's charity releases a report on the development of children under five during a pandemic.

item.title: Damilola Taylor: 'One of the last people to see him alive'
item.description: The BBC spoke to Grace Boyega on the 20th anniversary of the death of her friend, Damilola Taylor.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Tory MPs' hospital anger, and PM 'in retreat'
item.description: Sunday's papers are dominated by the new tier system, which has divided the Conservative party.

item.title: Hospitals 'may be overwhelmed without new tiers'
item.description: Michael Gove warns MPs strict rules are still needed in England despite lockdown ending on 2 December.

item.title: Covid ICU: A reality check on the virus's second wave
item.description: Aberdeen is not a Covid-19 hotspot but pressure on intensive care unit staff is starting to show.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccine: GPs in NI plan rollout for over 80s
item.description: GPs are advised to plan to vaccinate those over 80 who are not living in a care home from 4 January.

item.title: Renewable energy: Swansea homes retrofitted with smart tech
item.description: It is hoped the upgrades will allow the community to generate up to 60% of its own electricity.

item.title: Covid app 'sent me result of test I hadn't taken'
item.description: The Department of Health says the majority of test and trace app users have "no issues" with it.
